column4: I mean, it's really annoying when it tries to get a copy of the /boot/System.map-2.6.24-19-server file, which no longer exists, just so it can remove something I don't want anyway.
If your root filesystem is in a regular partition, then you can just stop using /boot.
It (my main filesystem) is on one system, but it's an LVM on another.
If the root ("/") is in RAID or LVM, then you should just backup and reinstall.
